introduction: Under the current Occupational Safety and Health Act, companies with more than 50 and less than 300 employees are required to undergo inspections by occupational health specialists appointed by the agency responsible for overseeing health management at the site. These inspections include assessments of the work environment, provision of health advice, and guidance on occupational diseases. The film begins by presenting the results of a year-long documentary capturing the implementation of workplace health management as mandated by this law.
